entry.title: English Breakfast Tea
entry.summary:
Vendor: Imperial Tea Garden
Type: Black Tea
Price: 4.00 - 88.00 (5 variants)

  • Description
  • Grade
  • Brewing
  • Caffeine
  • Great Britain is forever steeped in tea history.  Consider the events of the Boston Tea Party and the American Revolution, the Opium Wars, the clipper ship races from Fuzchou, China to Portsmouth UK, the Earl of Grey, and of course the English breakfast tradition. This is a blend of high mountain grown Ceylon tea from the regions of Nuwara Eliya, Dumbala, and Uva. English Breakfast tea is full bodied without being overpowering.



  • Origin:  Sri Lanka, Kenya & India

    Grade:  FP (Flowery Pekoe)

    Altitude: 4000 - 8500 feet above sea level

    Manufacture Type:  Orthodox (Traditional Leafy)

    Characteristics: A perfect breakfast tea with good body and full tea flavor notes. Coppery bright–especially enticing with milk.



  • Hot Tea Brewing Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: Put 1 slightly heaping teaspoon of loose tea for each 7-9 oz/200-260 ml of water in the teapot. Pour freshly boiled water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 3-7 minutes. Add milk and sugar to taste.


    Iced Tea Preparation Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: To make 1 L/1 QT, put 6 slightly heaping teaspoons of loose tea into a teapot. Pour 1¼ cups/315ml of boiling water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 5 minutes. Fill a serving pitcher 1/4 full with cold water. Pour tea into serving pitcher straining the tea. Add ice, top-up with cold water, garnish and sweeten to taste.

  • Caffeine Level ~ MEDIUM

entry.title: Strawberry Kiwi
entry.summary:
Vendor: Imperial Tea Garden
Type: Herbal Tea
Price: 4.00 - 36.00 (4 variants)

  • Description
  • Grade
  • Brewing
  • Caffeine
  • Strawberry Kiwi is a blend of dried herbs and fruit from Canada, United States, Thailand, and Spain.  This herb and fruit beverage has a down under appeal  with natural tartness that offers a bold and refreshing flavor.  Sweeten with sugar to bring out an even bolder flavor. 



  • Origin:  Ontario Canada / California USA / Sing Buri Thailand / Seville Spain

    Grade:  Grade #1 Herb & Fruit Pieces

    Altitude: Various

    Manufacture Type:  Blended.  Blend of air, sun and machine dried herbs and fruits

    Characteristics:  Bold strawberry kiwi flavor, tart, full bodied



  • Hot Tea Brewing Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: Put 2 slightly heaping teaspoons of loose tea for each 7-9 oz/200-260 ml of water in the teapot. Pour freshly boiled water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 5-10 minutes. Garnish and sweeten to taste.


    Iced Tea Preparation Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: To make 1 L/1 QT, put 12 slightly heaping teaspoons of loose tea into a teapot. Pour 1¼ cups/315ml of boiling water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 5-10 minutes. Fill a serving pitcher 1/4 full with cold water. Pour tea into serving pitcher.

  • Caffeine Level ~ NONE - Naturally Caffeine Free

entry.summary:
Vendor: Imperial Tea Garden
Type: Black Tea
Price: 4.00 - 80.00 (5 variants)

  • Description
  • Grade
  • Brewing
  • Caffeine
  • Kama Sutra Chai is an exotic blend of black tea and select herbs that appeals to the senses.  Ginger root, cardamom, coriander, cinnamon, clove, black pepper, rose petal, lavender, and jasmine buds round out this exotic blend of tea and spice.  Only high mountain grown black tea from India is used for Kama Sutra Chai tea.  Lift your spirits with this exciting blend of tea, herbs, and spice.



  • Origin:  Assam & Kerala India

    Grade: BP (Broken Pekoe)

    Altitude: 500 - 1500 feet above sea level

    Manufacture Type: CTC (Cut, Torn and Curled) & Orthodox (Traditional leafy)

    Characteristics:  Penetrating depth with a full flavored cup exuding sensuous floral and saucy spice notes



  • Hot Tea Brewing Recommendations:

  • Green Tea with mint is a blend of Chinese green tea and Washington grown spearmint.  A delicious and healthy green tea beverage that can be enjoyed by everyone.  Try adding freshly cut Ginger root to add a little extra Zing or pour over ice for a deliciously cool summer beverage!



  • Origin:  Zhejiang Province China / Washington State USA

entry.title: Green Tea with Ginseng
entry.summary:
Vendor: Imperial Tea Garden
Type: Green Tea
Price: 4.00 - 29.00 (4 variants)

  • Description
  • Grade
  • Brewing
  • Caffeine
  • Green tea with ginseng is a blend of Chinese green tea and Siberian ginseng root.  Two of the most healthy plants known are combined into one delicious beverage.  Enjoy the comfort of knowing that you are supplying your body with healthy nutrients and antioxidants needed to sustain good health.  Green tea is known for its high level of antioxidants that are finally becoming accepted in western health practices.  Siberian ginseng is also well known for its health benefits throughout the far east as a panacea.  ginseng allows the body to better cope with stress and resist fatigue when taken for a period of six weeks or more.  Try green tea with ginseng and rejuvenate yourself.  



  • Origin:  Zhejiang Province China

    Grade:  Special Chunmee Grade #1 with & Organic Eleuthero Root Ginseng

    Altitude: 1500 - 4500 feet above sea level

    Manufacture Type:  Non fermented, traditional process, Small batch crafted.

    Characteristics: Full bodied, delicate flavor with toasty notes. Mellow smokiness lending to sweet tobacco or plum character.



  • Hot Tea Brewing Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: Put 1 slightly heaping teaspoon of loose tea for each 7-9 oz/200-260 ml of water in the teapot. Pour freshly boiled water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 3-7 minutes. Add milk and sugar to taste.


    Iced Tea Preparation Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: To make 1 L/1 QT, put 6 slightly heaping teaspoons of loose tea into a teapot. Pour 1¼ cups/315ml of boiling water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 5 minutes. Fill a serving pitcher 1/4 full with cold water. Pour tea into serving pitcher straining the tea. Add ice, top-up with cold water, garnish and sweeten to taste    .

  • Caffeine Level ~ LOW

  • Cranberry Apple is a delicious blend of dried fruits and herbs from the United States, Canada, Thailand, and Spain.  This herb and fruit beverage consists of hibiscus petals, rose hips, dried pieces of apple and orange peel, and natural cranberry flavor.  This tea has a bold cranberry tartness, softened by hints of apple and orange.  This refreshing beverage has no caffeine and can be enjoyed hot or cold.

  • Very Berry is a delicious blend of dried fruits and herbs from the United States, Canada, Thailand, and Spain.  This herb and fruit beverage consists of hibiscus petals, raisins, rose hips, black and red currants, and natural flavor to produce a bold berry tartness.  Sweeten with sugar to bring out an even bolder flavor.  Try adding a few cloves and cinnamon sticks; simmer, then add some red wine for a mulled wine that's perfect for snuggling up to a warm fire.

  • Chamomile is a sweet and fruity herb that has been used for centuries as a gentle calming tonic.  We combined Egyptian chamomile with the best organic Washington grown mint to make a delicious herbal tea that soothes the nerves and digestive system.  Chamomile and mint are herbs, and therefore, naturally caffeine free.  Enjoy a cup after dinner, before bedtime, or any time you just want to relax and let your worries fade away.



  • Origin: Nile River Delta Egypy & Washington State USA

    Grade:  1st Grade

    Altitude: 1 - 1500 feet above sea level

    Manufacture Type:  Field grown, sun dried.

    Characteristics:  Full flavored and refreshing with mint highlights. Delightful lingering finish

entry.title: Dream Right®
entry.summary:
Vendor: Imperial Tea Garden
Type: Herbal Tea
Price: 4.00 - 20.00 (4 variants)

  • Description
  • Grade
  • Brewing
  • Caffeine
  • Dream Right herb tea is for those individuals who suffer from chronic insomnia or hyper activity and cannot get a good nights rest.  This proprietary blend of herbs is specifically blended to achieve results using all natural herbs without the addition of chemicals or additives. This tea contains:  spearmint, peppermint, chamomile, Valerian root, kava kava, hibiscus flowers, lemon balm, lemon grass hops, and lavender flowers. The minty flavor is a wonderful way to relax and enjoy a soothing night cap.

    Caution:  This product may cause drowsiness and inhibit your ability to operate motor vehicles or machinery.  Only drink this herbal tea at night.  Please consult your physician before using any herbal products as they may have adverse reactions to medications and certain individuals.

  • Origin: Multi National

    Grade: Blended

    Altitude: 1 - 4000 feet above sea level

    Manufacture Type: Blended

    Characteristics: Dominant minty tea with soothing herbal hints



  • Hot Tea Brewing Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: Put 1 slightly heaping teaspoon of loose tea for each 7-9 oz/200-260 ml of water in the teapot. Pour freshly boiled water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 3-7 minutes. Milk and sugar are not recommended.

    Not recommended for Iced tea

entry.title: Lemon Rooibos
entry.summary:
Vendor: Imperial Tea Garden
Type: Herbal Tea
Price: 5.00 - 28.00 (4 variants)

  • Description
  • Grade
  • Brewing
  • Caffeine
  • For over 300 years, Rooibos has been the traditional drink of the indigenous people of Cape Town, South Africa.  The locals harvested the fine needles from wild "Aspalathus Linearis" plants on the slopes of the beautiful Cedarberg Mountains.  They believed this red tea had tremendous healing powers and was regarded as a "miracle tea."  It wasn't until the early 1900's, when commercial exploitation began, that news of this elixir of the mind and body spread. Each cup of Rooibos tea is high in antioxidants contains essential minerals such as Iron, Potassium, Calcium, Copper, Zinc, Magnesium, Manganese, Fluoride, and Sodium.  To give this wonderful herb a twist we've added Lemon grass, Calendula petals, and natural lemon flavor.  Lemon Rooibos is a naturally caffeine free herbal tea that is sweet and flavorful.



  • Origin:  Cederberg South Africa

    Grade:  Choice Grade #1

    Altitude: 1500 - 2500 feet above sea level

    Manufacture Type:  Traditional process rolled & fermented

    Characteristics:  The lemon invigorates the fruity with sweet rooibos notes



  • Hot Tea Brewing Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: Put 1 slightly heaping teaspoon of loose tea for each 7-9 oz/200-260 ml of water in the teapot. Pour freshly boiled water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 3-7 minutes. Milk and sugar are not recommended.


    Iced Tea Preparation Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: To make 1 L/1 QT, put 6 slightly heaping teaspoons of loose tea into a teapot. Pour 1¼ cups/315ml of boiling water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 5 minutes. Fill a serving pitcher 1/4 full with cold water. Pour tea into serving pitcher straining the tea. Add ice, top-up with cold water, garnish and sweeten to taste.

  • Caffeine Level ~ NONE - Naturally Caffeine Free

entry.title: Earl Grey
entry.summary:
Vendor: Imperial Tea Garden
Type: Black Tea
Price: 4.00 - 88.00 (5 variants)

  • Description
  • Grade
  • Brewing
  • Caffeine
  • Earl Grey is named after its English benefactor, Charles Earl Grey, who for a short time served as Prime Minister (1830 - 1834) under King William IV. The unusual flavoring that makes Earl Grey so special is the oil of Bergamot which comes from the pear shaped citrus grown throughout the Mediterranean. The oil is pressed from the rind and is used for perfume as well as great tasting Earl Grey tea.  The essence of this exotic flavor is blended with only premium high mountain grown Ceylon tea from Nuwara Eliya, Dimbula and Uva districts.  This flavored black tea is sure to delight your senses, and is the perfect accompaniment with cakes and pastries.

     

  • Origin:  Nuwara, Dimbula & UVA Sri Lanka

    Grade:  OP (Orange Pekoe)

    Altitude: 4000 - 8500 feet above sea level

    Manufacture Type:  Orthodox (Traditional Leafy)

    Characteristic: flavorful and aromatic



  • Hot Tea Brewing Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: Put 1 slightly heaping teaspoon of loose tea for each 7-9 oz/200-260 ml of water in the teapot. Pour freshly boiled water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 3-7 minutes. Add milk and sugar to taste.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 5 minutes. Fill a serving pitcher 1/4 full with cold water. Pour tea into serving pitcher straining the tea. Add ice, top-up with cold water, garnish and sweeten to taste.

  • Caffeine Level ~ MEDIUM

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 5 minutes. Fill a serving pitcher 1/4 full with cold water. Pour tea into serving pitcher straining the tea. Add ice, top-up with cold water, garnish and sweeten to taste.

  • Caffeine Level ~ MEDIUM

entry.title: Chocolate Mint
entry.summary:
Vendor: Imperial Tea Garden
Type: Black Tea
Price: 4.50 - 32.00 (4 variants)

  • Description
  • Grade
  • Brewing
  • Caffeine
  • Chocolate Mint flavored black tea is made from high mountain grown Ceylon tea.  Only teas from reputable estates more than 5500 feet above sea level are used in this flavored tea. Fresh lively mint combined with the full flavor of chocolate. Reminiscent of an after dinner mint. Decadence without the guilt.

     

  • Origin:  Nuwara Eliya, Dimbula, & Uva Sri Lanka

    Grade:  OP (Orange Pekoe)

    Altitude: 4000 - 8500 feet above sea level

    Manufacture Type:  Orthodox (Traditional Leafy)

    Characteristics:  Fresh lovely mint combined with full flavored chocolate tea that is wonderfully reminiscent of an after-dinner mint.



  • Hot Tea Brewing Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: Put 1 slightly heaping teaspoon of loose tea for each 7-9 oz/200-260 ml of water in the teapot. Pour freshly boiled water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 3-7 minutes. Add milk and sugar to taste.


    Iced Tea Preparation Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: To make 1 L/1 QT, put 6 slightly heaping teaspoons of loose tea into a teapot. Pour 1¼ cups/315ml of boiling water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 5 minutes. Fill a serving pitcher 1/4 full with cold water. Pour tea into serving pitcher straining the tea. Add ice, top-up with cold water, garnish and sweeten to taste.

  • Caffeine Level ~ MEDIUM

  • Origin:  Nuwara Eliya, Dimbula, & Uva Sri Lanka

  • Mornings will never be the same after trying our maple flavored black tea.  The aroma and flavor round out any breakfast.  Don't be surprised if you get the urge for hot cakes and sausage after brewing our maple flavored black tea



  • Origin:  Nuwara Eliya, Dimbula, & Uva Sri Lanka

    Grade:  OP (Orange Pekoe)

    Altitude: 4000 - 8500 feet above sea level

    AMOUNT TO USE: Put 1 slightly heaping teaspoon of loose tea for each 7-9 oz/200-260 ml of water in the teapot. Pour freshly boiled water over tea.

entry.title: Satsuma
entry.summary:
Vendor: Imperial Tea Garden
Type: Black Tea
Price: 4.50 - 32.00 (4 variants)

  • Description
  • Grade
  • Brewing
  • Caffeine
  • Satsuma Flavored black tea conjures up images of bygone days of ancient Japan, where Samurai, Geisha, and Emperors once ruled. Satsuma was the name of what is now known as the Kagoshima Prefecture on the southern tip of Kyushu Island.  This ancient kingdom is where the Satsuma, (Latin: Citrus reticulata) is believed to have originated.  Sometimes referred to as Satsuma Mandarin, or Satsuma Tangerine, this little fruit has been prized by the people who inhabited the region for centuries.  Orange Pekoe grade leaf from Sri lanka is flavored with natural oils and blended with Calendula petals, White Daisy, Lemon Balm, Cornflower petals, Dried Orange and Marigold for a bright and coppery cup.  This tea is equally delicious served hot or over ice for a truly remarkable iced tea.



  • Origin:  Nuwara Eliya, Dimbula, & Uva Sri Lanka

    Grade:  OP (Orange Pekoe)

    Altitude: 4000 - 8500 feet above sea level

    Manufacture Type:  Orthodox (Traditional Leafy)

    Characteristics:  A tea that is sprightly and alive with a bright cleansing cup.  Hints of lime and passion fruit perk up the finish.



  • Hot Tea Brewing Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: Put 1 slightly heaping teaspoon of loose tea for each 7-9 oz/200-260 ml of water in the teapot. Pour freshly boiled water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 3-7 minutes. Add milk and sugar to taste.


    Iced Tea Preparation Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: To make 1 L/1 QT, put 6 slightly heaping teaspoons of loose tea into a teapot. Pour 1¼ cups/315ml of boiling water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 5 minutes. Fill a serving pitcher 1/4 full with cold water. Pour tea into serving pitcher straining the tea. Add ice, top-up with cold water, garnish and sweeten to taste.

  • Caffeine Level ~ MEDIUM

entry.title: China Black Tea
entry.summary:
Vendor: Imperial Tea Garden
Type: Black Tea
Price: 4.00 - 26.00 (4 variants)

  • Description
  • Grade
  • Brewing
  • Caffeine
  • This loose leaf tea is comprised of flowery orange pekoe from 16 different growing regions of central and southern China.  Don't be fooled by the low price.  Imperial Tea Garden buys large quantities of this exceptional tea and passes on those savings to you.  If you are new to tea, this is a good place to start defining your palate.  China Black tea is known for its smooth character and rich flavor.



  • Origin:  China

    Grade:  FOP (Flowery Orange Pekoe)

    Altitude: 1500 - 4900 feet above sea level

    Manufacture Type:  Orthodox (Traditional Leafy)

    Characteristics: Excellent fullness with subtle China sweetness. 



  • Hot Tea Brewing Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: Put 1 slightly heaping teaspoon of loose tea for each 7-9 oz/200-260 ml of water in the teapot. Pour freshly boiled water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 3-7 minutes. Add milk and sugar to taste.


    Iced Tea Preparation Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: To make 1 L/1 QT, put 6 slightly heaping teaspoons of loose tea into a teapot. Pour 1¼ cups/315ml of boiling water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 5 minutes. Fill a serving pitcher 1/4 full with cold water. Pour tea into serving pitcher straining the tea. Add ice, top-up with cold water, garnish and sweeten to taste    .

  • Caffeine Level ~ MEDIUM

entry.title: Market Spice
entry.summary:
Vendor: Imperial Tea Garden
Type: Black Tea
Price: 4.00 - 28.00 (4 variants)

  • Description
  • Grade
  • Brewing
  • Caffeine
  • Ceylon market spice is a tea for those who are daring and looking for something a little different.  The select leaves are only high mountain grown so quality is assured.  The taste and aroma excite the senses with each sip.  The blend of cloves and cinnamon compliment each others distinct taste and aroma.



  • Origin:  Sri Lanka

    Grade:  FOP (Flowery Orange Pekoe)

    Altitude: 3500 - 4500 feet above sea level

    Manufacture Type:  Blended Orthodox (Traditional Leafy)

    Characteristics: A perfect blend quality high mountain grown tea and cinnamon and clove to heighten the senses.

     



  • Hot Tea Brewing Recommendations:
    AMOUNT TO USE: Put 1 slightly heaping teaspoon of loose tea for each 7-9 oz/200-260 ml of water in the teapot. Pour freshly boiled water over tea.

    BREWING RECOMMENDATIONS: Steep 3-7 minutes. Add milk and sugar to taste.


    Iced Tea Preparation Recommendations:
     Not Recommended for Iced Tea

  • Caffeine Level ~ MEDIUM
